meta.title: Warden Oracle Guidance Registry
meta.description: Codified structural and semantic guidance for system elements.

DLR_MSN_BRIEF.title: Mission Brief Standard
DLR_MSN_BRIEF.purpose: To align Director intent with Engineer execution from Turn 1.
structure: Context: The background and status quo.
Problem: The specific friction or gap to be addressed.
Constraint: Non-negotiable limits (technical or governance).
Success: The quantifiable win condition.

SQA_ANCHORING.title: System Quality Attribute Anchoring
SQA_ANCHORING.purpose: To ensure plans are evaluated against non-functional quality standards.
structure: Domain: [Operational|Structural|Environmental|User-Centric]
Attribute: Key from registry/attributes.json
Reasoning: Why this attribute is critical for this cycle.

DLR_ARTIFACT_AUDIT.title: Artifact Audit Standard
DLR_ARTIFACT_AUDIT.purpose: To verify the quality and scope of generated artifacts/patches.
structure: Path: The file system location of the artifact.
Status: [PASS|FAIL|WARN]
Analysis: Qualitative review of the content (Security, Style, Logic).

DLR_PIR_REVIEW.title: PIR Review Standard
DLR_PIR_REVIEW.purpose: To perform a post-mortem analysis of the cycle efficacy.
structure: Success Score: 0-10 based on objective satisfaction.
Anomalies: Any unexpected behaviors or breaches.
Remediations: Actionable steps to prevent recurrence.

DLR_COMPLIANCE_AUDIT.title: Compliance Audit Standard
DLR_COMPLIANCE_AUDIT.purpose: To reconcile Engineer claims against System Evidence.
structure: Omission Analysis: Explaining why certain claims don't match logs.
Trust Score: System-generated reconciliation percentage.
Verdict: [SUCCESS|FAILURE] based on intent vs reality.

STD_FILE_CONSOLIDATION.title: File Consolidation Standard
STD_FILE_CONSOLIDATION.purpose: To maintain a single-root architecture and prevent directory drift.
structure: Constraint: No unauthorized root directories allowed.
Mechanism: Enforcement via validation/audit_standards.js.

IDEA_V1.title: Idea Management Protocol v1
IDEA_V1.purpose: A lightweight channel for capturing unrefined thoughts upstream of implementation.

states.1_CAPTURE: Recording the raw idea title and intent.
states.2_INCUBATE: Refinement dialogue between Director and Engineer.

CONCEPT.title: High-Fidelity Concept Standard
CONCEPT.purpose: An immutable technical specification that preserves architectural intent across ZK rotations.
structure: Provenance: Link to source Idea ID.
Verbose Context: Synthesis of incubation dialogue.
Architectural Blueprint: Tools, logic, and registry changes.
Decision Log: Rationale for pattern selection.
Success Metrics: How the next ZK entity verifies completion.

CONCEPT_REGISTRY.title: High-Fidelity Concept Registry
CONCEPT_REGISTRY.purpose: To store the architectural rationales and technical specifications for ratified system evolutions.
structure: Index: registry/concepts.json
Specifications: registry/concepts/CON-###.json
Tooling: node engine/concept.js list

ZK_INTERACTION_PATTERNS.title: Zero-Knowledge Interaction Patterns
ZK_INTERACTION_PATTERNS.purpose: To define deterministic communication standards between AI Agents and the Warden system.
structure: Constraint: AI Agents lack a TTY/interactive shell. All inputs must be passed as CLI arguments.
Verification: Affirmations and Pledges must be provided as a comma-separated list of values.
Audit Trail: Passing values as arguments ensures they are captured in the system's execution logs.

QUIZ.title: Interactive Verification Quiz (Deterministic)
QUIZ.purpose: A mandatory gate to verify behavioral alignment and technical proficiency.
structure: Command: node engine/oracle.js quiz <pledge|exam> "ans1,ans2,..." [--interpretation "Your analysis"]
The Pledge: Behavioral affirmations of Prime Directives. Required for Onboarding. REQUIRES --interpretation.
The Exam: Technical scenario challenges for tool mastery. Required for PRY_V2 graduation.
Qualitative Handshake: The --interpretation flag forces ZK entities to explain their obligations in their own words.

PRIME_DIRECTIVES.title: Warden Prime Directives (ZK-Fidelity)
PRIME_DIRECTIVES.purpose: To establish immutable behavioral constraints for Zero-Knowledge entities.
structure: PD-001 (External Authority): Director tokens are strictly external. Self-generation is a Protocol Breach.
PD-002 (Wait Operator): If a state requires a Director ([DLR_]) approval, the only valid action is to STOP and await external authorization.
PD-003 (Atomic Turns): One interaction turn equals a maximum of one state transition. Chaining transitions across Director Gates is prohibited.

CANONICAL_INTERACTION.title: Canonical Command Model
CANONICAL_INTERACTION.purpose: To ensure bit-perfect audit fidelity by classifying CLI strings into structured objects.
structure: Every 'warden.js exec' call is intercepted and classified.
Recognized commands receive an INT-ID (e.g., INT-GOV-INIT).
Unrecognized commands trigger the Socratic Brake.
Verified interactions are cited by ID in the Engineer Report.

REPORT_DRAFTING.title: Automated Audit Drafting
REPORT_DRAFTING.purpose: To eliminate the friction of manual claim generation.
structure: Execute 'node engine/report.js --draft' to generate engineer_report.json.
The tool citations are derived directly from the canonical intent log.
The Engineer must still add qualitative analysis to satisfy the 3-Way Audit.

INTENT_REGISTRATION.title: Registering New Intent Patterns
INTENT_REGISTRATION.purpose: To expand system observability to new tools and workflows.
structure: Locate 'registry/intent_patterns.json'.
Add a new pattern object with a unique ID and regex.
Define the 'intent' object mapping regex capture groups to tool actions.
Perform a GOV cycle to ratify the registry update.
